abstract: U.S. officials need to weigh the uncertain benefits against the broader implications of breaching personal security, the high commissioner said.
snippet: U.S. officials need to weigh the uncertain benefits against the broader implications of breaching personal security, the high commissioner said.
lead_paragraph: GENEVA — The top human rights official at the United Nations warned the United States authorities on Friday that their efforts to force Apple to unlock an iPhone belonging to a gunman risked helping authoritarian governments and jeopardizing the security of millions around the world.

headline.main: U.N. Rights Chief Says Unlocking Gunman’s iPhone Could Open ‘Pandora’s Box’
